author: Nina Trentmann
title: CFO Moves: Tate & Lyle, Celanese

organizations.name: wall street journal  tate & lyle plc

text:
0 COMMENTS CFO's on the move. Photo: The Wall Street Journal 
Tate & Lyle PLC , a British ingredients maker, appointed Imran Nawa z chief financial officer, effective August 1, 2018. He succeeds Nick Hampton who became Tate & Lyle CEO on April 1, 2018. Mr. Nawaz joins Tate & Lyle from Mondelēz International Inc. where he has been senior vice president finance Europe since 2014.
He will receive an annual salary of £470,000 ($656,925) and a company contribution to his pension plan of 20% of base salary. Mr. Nawaz will also be eligible for a bonus under the company’s bonus plan. The plan currently provides for a bonus paid at 50% of salary at target and a maximum opportunity of 175% of salary. He will also be eligible to receive a performance share plan award of up to 300% of base salary which will be subject to a three-year performance period. To compensate for forfeited incentive awards at Mondelēz International, Mr. Nawaz will be handed a one-off restricted stock award of £800,000 worth of shares in Tate & Lyle, according to a filing. 
Celanese Corp. , a Dallas-based technology and speciality materials company, named Benita M. Casey chief accounting officer. She succeeds Kevin Oliver who is becoming CFO of Celanese’s European operations in Amsterdam. Ms. Casey joined the company in January 2018 as vice president finance and controller. Prior to that, she held the position of senior vice president internal audit at J.C. Penney Co. and was vice president corporate audit with Dr Pepper Snapple Group Inc. from 2008 to 2014. Compensation details were not immediately available.
